Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol 2: Etiquette of Travel
As for the deniers (Al-Jahidun) and the heedless (Al-Ghafilun) and those deceived by the shimmering mirage of the world's bloom, they do not see and they do not hear because they are isolated from hearing (As-Sam') and veiled from the signs of their Lord. They know an outward aspect (Zahiran) of the worldly life (Al-Hayat Ad-Dunya) and they are from the Hereafter (Al-Akhirah) they are heedless (Ghafilun). And what is intended by hearing (As-Sam') is not the outward hearing (As-Sam' Az-Zahir), for those intended by it were not isolated from it. Rather, what is intended is the inward hearing (As-Sam' Al-Batin). And by the outward hearing (As-Sam' Az-Zahir) only sounds are perceived, and in it, the human shares with all other animals. As for the inward hearing (As-Sam' Al-Batin), by it is perceived the tongue of the state (Lisan Al-Hal) which is an utterance beyond the utterance of speech (Nutuq Al-Maqal).

Therefore you see the intelligent ones in worldly matters and in the knowledge of medicine, arithmetic, geometry, and philosophy as ignorant in matters of the Hereafter, and the intelligent ones in the subtleties of the sciences of the Hereafter as ignorant in most of the sciences of this world, because the power of the intellect (Aql) does not suffice for both matters together in most cases, so one of them becomes a barrier from perfection in the second. Therefore the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Most of the people of Paradise are the simple-minded' meaning simple-minded in worldly matters. And Al-Hasan said in some of his sermons: 'We have encountered people whom if you saw them, you would say they are mad, and if they encountered you, they would say you are devils.' So whenever you hear something strange from the matters of religion, the intelligent ones in all other sciences deny it, so do not let their denial deceive you from accepting it, since it is impossible for one traveling the path of the East to attain what exists in the West. Similarly, the affair of this world and the Hereafter proceeds. Therefore Allah the Exalted said: 'Indeed, those who do not expect the meeting with Us and are satisfied with the life of this world and feel secure therein...' [the verse]. And He said: 'They know an outward (Zahir) from the life of this world, but they, from the Hereafter, they are heedless (Ghafilun).' And He the Mighty and Majestic said: 'So turn away from whoever turns away from Our Remembrance (Dhikr) and desires not except the life of this world. That is their extent of knowledge.' So combining perfect insight (Istibsar) into the benefits of this world and religion hardly becomes easy except for those whom Allah has firmly established to manage His servants in their livelihood (Ma'ash) and their return (Ma'ad), and they are the prophets supported by the Spirit of Holiness (Ruh al-Qudus), drawing from the divine power (Al-Quwwah al-Ilahiyyah) that expands for all matters and does not become narrow from them. The Seventh Remembrance (Wird): When the sun yellows by approaching the earth such that its light covers the expressions and vapors on the face of the earth and a yellowness is seen in its light, the time of this Remembrance (Wird) enters. It is like the first Remembrance (Wird) from the rising of dawn to the rising of the sun because it is before sunset, just as that is before sunrise. This is what is intended by His saying, the Exalted: 'So glorify Allah when you reach evening and when you reach morning.' And this is the second extremity intended by His saying, the Exalted: 'So glorify and the extremities of the day.' Al-Hasan said: They used to have greater reverence for the evening than for the beginning of the day. And some of the predecessors said: They used to make the beginning of the day for the worldly life (Dunya) and its end for the Hereafter (Akhirah). So it is recommended in this time the Glorification (Tasbih) and the Seeking of Forgiveness (Istighfar) especially, and the rest of what we mentioned in the first Remembrance (Wird), such as saying: 'I seek forgiveness from Allah, there is no god but He, the Living, the Sustainer, and I ask Him for repentance, and glory be to Allah the Great and with His praise,' taken from His saying, the Exalted: 'And seek forgiveness for your sin and glorify with the praise of your Lord in the evening and the morning.' The Fourth Litany [al-wird] is what is between the zenith [al-zawal] and the completion of the Dhuhr prayer and its regular Sunnah. This is the shortest of the day's litanies and the most excellent of them. So, if he had performed ablution [wudu] before the zenith and was present in the mosque, then whenever the sun has passed its zenith and the caller to prayer [mu'adhdhin] begins the call [adhan], let him wait until the completion of the response to his call. Then let him rise to enliven what is between the call [adhan] and the establishment [iqamah], for it is the time of the appearance [al-izhar] which Allah, the Exalted, intended by His saying: "And when you appear [tazharun]" (30:18). And let him pray in this time four rak'ahs, not separating between them with a single salutation [taslimah wahidah]. Concerning this prayer alone, among all the other prayers of the day, some scholars have transmitted that he prays it with a single salutation, but that narration has been criticized. The school [madhhab] of Al-Shafi'i, may Allah be pleased with him, is that he prays it two by two [mathna mathna] like all other supererogatory prayers [nawafil] and separates with a salutation, and it is that which the reports have confirmed as sound. And let him lengthen these rak'ahs, for in them the gates of the heaven are opened, as we have mentioned the report concerning it in the chapter on supererogatory prayer [salah al-tatawwu']. And let him recite in them Surah Al-Baqarah, or a surah from the Hundreds [al-mi'in], or four from the Repeated Verses [al-mathani]. For these are hours in which supplication [du'a'] is answered, and the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, loved that a deed be raised up for him within them. Then he prays Dhuhr in congregation after four long rak'ahs, as preceded, or short onesâ€”it is not fitting that he neglects them. Then let him pray after Dhuhr two rak'ahs, then four. For Ibn Mas'ud disliked that an obligatory prayer [fard] be followed by its like without a separation. And it is recommended [mustahabb] that he recite in this supererogatory prayer [nafilah] the Verse of the Throne [Ayat al-Kursi] and the end of Surah Al-Baqarah and the verses which we mentioned in the First Litany, so that this may combine for him between supplication [du'a'], remembrance [dhikr], recitation [qira'ah], prayer [salah], praise [tahmid], and glorification [tasbih] along with the nobility of the time.

In you are wonders indicating the majesty of Allah, the Exalted, that lifetimes would not suffice to grasp a tenth of a tenth of it, while you are heedless of it. So, O you who are heedless of your own self (Nafs) and ignorant of it, how can you aspire to know others when Allah, the Exalted, has commanded you to reflect upon your self (Nafs) in His Noble Book, saying: 'And in your own selves (Anfusikum) - will you not then see?' And He mentioned that you are created from a filthy sperm-drop (Nutfah Qadhirah), saying: 'Woe to man! How ungrateful he is! From what thing did He create him? From a sperm-drop (Nutfah) He created him and then proportioned him. Then He made the way easy for him. Then He causes him to die and puts him in his grave. Then when He wills, He will resurrect him.' And He, the Exalted, said: 'And among His Signs (Ayat) is that He created you from dust, then, behold, you are human beings dispersing.' And He, the Exalted, said: 'Was he not a sperm-drop (Nutfah) from semen emitted? Then he was a clinging clot ('Alaqah), then He created and proportioned.' And He, the Exalted, said: 'Did We not create you from a despised water (Ma'in Mahin)? Then We placed it in a firm lodging (Qararin Makin) for a known term.' And He said: 'Does not man see that We created him from a sperm-drop (Nutfah)? Then, behold, he is a clear adversary.' And He said: 'Indeed, We created man from a sperm-drop mixture (Nutfatin Amshaj).' Then He mentioned how He made the sperm-drop (Nutfah) into a clinging clot ('Alaqah), and the clinging clot ('Alaqah) into a chewed lump (Mudghah), and the chewed lump (Mudghah) into bones, saying, the Exalted: 'And certainly did We create man from an extract of clay. a.g: And when adversity touches the people, they call upon their Lord, turning in repentance to Him. Then when He lets them taste mercy from Him, at once a party of them associate others with their Lord,
So that they will deny what We have granted them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you are going to know.
Or have We sent down to them an authority, and it speaks of what they were associating with Him?
And when We let the people taste mercy, they rejoice therein, but if evil afflicts them for what their hands have put forth, immediately they despair.
Do they not see that Allah extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]? Indeed, in that are signs for a people who believe.
So give the relative his right, as well as the needy and the traveler. That is best for those who desire the countenance of Allah, and it is they who will be the successful.
And whatever you give for interest to increase within the wealth of people will not increase with Allah. But what you give in zakah, desiring the countenance of Allah - those are the multipliers.

And as for seeking increase, it falls under His saying, the Exalted: 'And do not confer favor to acquire more' (Quran 74:6), meaning you give to seek more, and under His saying, the Exalted: 'And whatever you give of usury (riba) to increase in the wealth of people, it does not increase with Allah' (Quran 30:39). For usury (riba) is the increase, and this is seeking increase in general, even if it is not in usurious wealth. All of that is disliked (makruh) and an innovation (bid'ah) in marriage that resembles trade and gambling, and it corrupts the purposes of marriage.

a.g: Allah is the one who created you, then provided for you, then will cause you to die, and then will give you life. Are there any of your "partners" who does anything of that? Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

Corruption has appeared throughout the land and sea by [reason of] what the hands of people have earned so He may let them taste part of [the consequence of] what they have done that perhaps they will return [to righteousness].
Say, [O Muhammad], "Travel through the land and observe how was the end of those before. Most of them were associators [of others with Allah].
So direct your face toward the correct religion before a Day comes from Allah of which there is no repelling. That Day, they will be divided.
Whoever disbelieves - upon him is [the consequence of] his disbelief. And whoever does righteousness - they are for themselves preparing,
That He may reward those who have believed and done righteous deeds out of His bounty. Indeed, He does not like the disbelievers.

And of His signs is that He sends the winds as bringers of good tidings and to let you taste His mercy and so the ships may sail at His command and so you may seek of His bounty, and perhaps you will be grateful.

And We have already sent messengers before you to their peoples, and they came to them with clear evidences; then We took retribution from those who committed crimes, and incumbent upon Us was support of the believers.

It is Allah who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds and spread them in the sky however He wills, and He makes them fragments so you see the rain emerge from within them. And when He causes it to fall upon whom He wills of His servants, immediately they rejoice
Although they were, before it was sent down upon them - before that, in despair.
So observe the effects of the mercy of Allah - how He gives life to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed, that [same one] will give life to the dead, and He is over all things competent.
But if We should send a [bad] wind and they saw [their crops] turned yellow, they would remain thereafter disbelievers.
So indeed, you will not make the dead hear, nor will you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs, retreating.
And you cannot guide the blind away from their error. You will only make hear those who believe in Our verses so they are Muslims [in submission to Allah].
Allah is the one who created you from weakness, then made after weakness strength, then made after strength weakness and white hair. He creates what He wills, and He is the Knowing, the Competent.
And the Day the Hour appears the criminals will swear they had remained but an hour. Thus they were deluded.
But those who were given knowledge and faith will say, "You remained the extent of Allah 's decree until the Day of Resurrection, and this is the Day of Resurrection, but you did not used to know."
So that Day, their excuse will not benefit those who wronged, nor will they be asked to appease [Allah].

And We have certainly presented to the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example. But, [O Muhammad], if you should bring them a sign, the disbelievers will surely say, "You [believers] are but falsifiers."
Thus does Allah seal the hearts of those who do not know.
So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And let them not disquiet you who are not certain [in faith].
